content.webTitle: Saturday Sundae: Traoré goes for the gloves and Stelling’s spooky surprise

fields.headline: Saturday Sundae: Traoré goes for the gloves and Stelling’s spooky surprise
fields.bodyText: MAN OF THE DAY Last week Ayoze Pérez scored his first for Newcastle and won them three points at Spurs. He was at it again against Liverpool. SCAPEGOAT OF THE DAY Mario Balotelli – managed one touch inside Newcastle’s box, and took his run without a league goal to 689 minutes. Team-mates not giving him the ball may be a factor. BEST AWKWARD FACTS £30m Cesc Fàbregas now has as many assists this season as £42m Mesut Özil managed in the whole of last season; and Cristiano Ronaldo has found the net 20 times since Aston Villa last scored. WINTER WEAR While London sweltered in 18C November sunshine, QPR’s Armand Traoré decided he just couldn’t do without gloves. MOST PUT-OUT Joey Barton played for QPR’s Under-21s in the morning as he recovers from injury, and planned to spend his afternoon watching the seniors at Chelsea. He couldn’t get a ticket and went to Brentford v Derby instead. MOST COSMOPOLITAN Eddy Pascual, who played for Granada against Real Madrid having come through at Milan, has a dad from Angola and a mother from Azerbaijan. He was born in Spain. BEST HALLOWEEN MOMENT Nick Cotton’s EastEnders comeback trumped by the lights going out on Jeff Stelling. Cue grown pundits making ghost noises. COMEBACK OF THE DAY Three goals in 20 minutes had Elgin feeling smug in their Scottish Cup game against Bo’ness United. Bo’ness then hit three in eight minutes to draw level. It ended 4-4.
